work.summary: I wrote, taught, and examined the “Internet Computing” course that is part of the M.Sc. degree in the School of Computer Science and Informatics.
Working on the `PROMISE <https://promise-noe.eu>`_ EU project with a focus on developing an evaluation framework and test-bed for Interactive Information Retrieval.
My work focused on developing and maintaining the demonstration systems for the Tripod EU project in the run-up to the final review.
Working on the `PATHS <http://paths-project.eu>`_ project that aims to develop novel user-interfaces for accessing digital Cultural Heritage collections.

I part-wrote, taught, and examined an “Introduction to Computers Science” course that is part of the Geographic Information Systems specialisation of the Geography degree at the Alpen-Adria Universität Klagenfurt.
With a colleague we developed an on-line system for digitising historic documents for the History Department.

My work focused on developing an automatic geo-referencing system for historical records. This made it possible to automatically locate historic documents for a given place or area. In addition I developed some sample applications, such as the Domesday on a Map.
PhD studentship on the Tripod project researching methods for the automatic translation between natural language and co-ordinate representations of locations.
Employed on the HarmonISA EU project to develop a system for automatically integrating land-use and land-cover data-sets from Austria, Italy, and Slovenia.
I was responsible for the introduction, development and maintenance of an on-line course management system.
Contract-work to develop an HTML+CSS rendering system.

Teaching a variety of modules ranging from an introduction to programming to the development of mobile web applications.

Research focuses on the areas of information visualisation, particularly for qualitative data, the question of how to give a user an overview over a given data-set, and the user evaluation of interactive information retrieval systems.
Research and Teaching in the field of eHumanities / Digital Humanities.
Providing teaching cover for modules in the HCI/IoT area
Teaching in the area of Networking and Web Development. Research into Interactive Information Retrieval, Digital Cultural Heritage, and Digital Humanities

education.summary: My work looked at the potential negative impact of various quality assurance processes on the quality of higher education.

education.summary: Equivalent to a M.Sc. in Computer Science. My specialisation was in Knowledge Engineering and Geographical Information systems, which led to my master thesis “A Semantic Similarity Measure for Formal Ontologies”.

My PhD focused on developing quantitative models for spatial prepositions. Based on these quantitative models I developed systems for automatically interpreting and generating spatial-language expressions that can be tried out online. The PhD was conducted in the context of the Tripod EU project and is available from the `publications <{filename}../pages/publications.rst>`_, as are a number of papers on various aspects of the work.
Equivalent to a B.Sc. in Computer Science with a specialisation in Computational Linguistics.
